I hope Apple Pay and Android Pay are coming to Belgium soon
looks easy to me, swipe up, choose a card, pay. easier than taking out the wallet, inserting the card, pin, waiting there while it all loads yadayada
i’m up for any kind of *Pay, seriously, it’s 2015 we need to pay with our phones ffs
as long as the reliablity is top notch then im (swipe) up for it

and often you find out the wireless part is disabled/not workin

You don't have NFC payment stuff in here
A Belgian paper about why someone doesn't want to be Belgian, I have the same opinion: <http://www.demorgen.be/binnenland/waarom-wij-geen-belg-meer-willen-zijn-a2395988/>

attachments.title: Waarom wij geen Belg meer willen zijn
attachments.text: Er was eens een Amerikaan, een Indonesiër, een Australische, een IJslander en een Canadees. Ooit waren ze Belg, maar om uiteenlopende redenen namen ze&hellip;
attachments.fallback: De Morgen: Waarom wij geen Belg meer willen zijn

text: You can translate it

Well here's the quote that's important:
>If you were to have a daring plan in Belgium, people would say "Would you do that?" while they would say "Awesome!" in America.
it’s not NFC payment, samsung pay works with most of POS terminals in the world, since S6 implements LoopPay tech
really cool tech

<@U0548MM6B>: Belgium solely uses chips. We never use swiping POS terminals.

One thing America could learn from us is security though

<@U0548MM6B>: none atm. But we're thinking about letting the users pay a very small fee for paying online, have them store credit on their Lunchbreak account (to press the flat rates) and make stores pay extra to accept online payments. All because there is not a single viable option for micropayments.

ah

oh

It shouldn’t matter what order shit is in, and if it does, make it consistent.
the material slack has waaay too many people

hardly an intern
or is he

or mine
<@U0548MM6B|bluecup> uploaded a file: <https://androidchat.slack.com/files/bluecup/F07R03H1D/pwf_vrt7gbszd-gn5znqlmnh5ohv-mhkqzvfelepqgm.png|pwF_vrT7GBsZD-GN5ZnqlmNh5oHv-mhKqZvfelepQgM.png>
I know. I just saw that to make me feel better. lol
just posted this to hangouts lol (haven't really laughed at loud just snickered a bit while sipping my coffee)
<@U060Q7J2Y>: I know there is probably a reason for it, I just hate the way actionbar and toolbar play together
Especially when it’s like…well, title needs to come before you do this, and then you need to set it, and then you need to set somethings on the action bar.
It feels less magical than appcompat can be sometimes
I should be able to go, hey toolbar, your title should be this, and the color should be this, and actionbar shouldn’t care.
yeah
I feel like I waste unnecessary time, then again, I am so frustrated working on this crap code.
I think that’s leading to some frustration.
I apparently held up a QA build today because some of the buttons had all caps texts because their themes are out of freaking control.
All I had to do was set textAllCaps false in the theme, didn’t even notice they were capitolized.
is the capitalization of the button text essential to being able to test?
apparently so
fucking apparently ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
Imagine me at 8 am this morning hearing that.
On a hangouts call from India.
tell me it wasn’t an offshore
oh god
so they didn’t test all day
Well, there are ~ 7 devs there on Android, and then me and <@U07DEGHHT> here.
Who is having a great day btw.
back when i worked with an offshore team i would just get those questions at 2 AM
not sure what’s worse
I was answering emails at 2 this morning.
and getting questions on why I set up build variants the way I did
Well for one, because you were commenting your server URLs in out of strings.xml based on what servers you wanted.
and 2. because that’s the way I wanted them.
do… people usually put configuration strings in strings.xml? i pretty much only use it for translatable stuff
for endpoint URLs and such it can just go in a class or build config if it can change
No… people don’t usually do that.
nope
As a matter of fact, I have never seen anyone do that.
I have some config strings but I have them in a well named strings file and its obvious what is going on because they replace library strings that are documented
it can be useful since variants can modify them
It would only make sense if you had a seperate strings xml for different variants already and there was more than one string to replace
Even then, for something  you use as often as your server url, you should have it somewhere you don’t have to pass contexts around into deep classes all day.
i shy away from that because you need a context to access them
which can be annoying
But yeah, I built it out with different app names in strings.xml and a single java file.
+1 to not needing context
also, our endpoints are configurable for debug builds anyway
Plus, it’s also helpful when you want to add tools and stuff to one variant (like QA having their tools in their builds) and it’s not in the production one.
I'm only in 2 slack groups. My own and this one.
i’m only in this one :disappointed: need more
so i can complain about having too many
Well I'm on IRC too so there's that

but it doesn’t work at work for some reason
hexchat that is

So I haven't been online much this month, and I'm normally online 24/7
Connection failed (certificate not trusted.? (27)) is what i get sometimes, though of course it’s connecting fine now
i’ve googled around and haven’t figured it out, it’s intermittent for everyone
I just get "connected closed by peer"
ah yeah, i’ve gotten that before
I have to reconnect every single time and ghost my nickname.

I like it on IRC that you just ask your question and be on with your life
Well for most channels
that's how slack operates for me
can you not do that here? lol
Perhaps, I haven't looked into IRC <-> Slack thingy yet

I just go into IRC and get ignored

<https://sites.google.com/a/android.com/tools/recent/androidstudio13releasecandidate3available|Android Studio 1.3 Release Candidate 3 Available>
Android Studio 1.3 RC 3 is now available in the canary channel. This is just a small bug fix update relative to the previous release candidates with the following fixes:Tweak the default IDE heap size to be a bit largerTurn off EAP mode (reduces internal validation checks etc)Fix top crashes from the crash reporter:22523040: AssertionError in AppResourceRepository22530524: Fixing NPE in OCStringLiteralCopyPasteProcessor22519147: java.lang.Throwable in...

text: has anyone tried the nearby api?
yeah i played with the sample a bit
seems to actually work well
do you have to be in the same wifi network for it to work for now?
or will it still work if i turn of bluetooth and wifi?
no it depends on wifi
its unclear if that will remain in the new version coming up
but that is a week or two out
awright thanks :simple_smile:

we know it will use inaudible sound for instance but that isn’t a reliable transmission method nor does it have very significant bandwidth so I imagine that will only be used to say ‘hello’ to other devices to start the handshake processes
why do you say that isnt reliable?
can you hear your phone well in a loud room say a club?
various factors in various environments makes inaudible transmission sometimes good sometimes bad
but always low throughput
I cant find a chart of hard numbers but I *believe* the best you can get is well under 100kbps
but since they are limiting to inaudible they are reducing their total range therefore it is likely less than that
<http://chirp.io|chirp.io> is a good example of this, to send data it uses chirps as the handshake because sending even a photo would take minutes
looking for whitepapers it looks like some people have managed to get quite a bit of speed but still well under 1mbps and not using hardware available in phones
interesting stuff
might read up more on it this weekend
check out <http://chirp.io|chirp.io>
they have an sdk you can use if its something that may ‘improve’ your app
currently i dont have a usecase for it but hey, more toys to play with
:simple_smile:
: shrug :
